protocol_name: Plasma-derived exosomal preparation and isolation of RNA
protocol_name_html: Plasma-derived exosomal preparation and isolation of RNA
manuscript_citation: Svedman FC, Lohcharoenkal W, Bottai M, Brage SE, Sonkoly E, Hansson J, Pivarcsi A, Eriksson H (2018) Extracellular microvesicle microRNAs as predictive biomarkers for targeted therapy in metastastic cutaneous malignant melanoma. PLoS ONE 13(11): e0206942. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0206942
authors: Fernanda Svedman,Warangkana Lohcharoenkal,Matteo Bottai,Suzanne Egyhazi Brage,Enikö Sonkoly,Johan Hansson,Andor Pivarcsi,Hanna Eriksson

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"5a05i","text":"  MiRCURY Exosome Isolation Kit-Serum and Plasma (Exiqon, Denmark) was used for isolation of plasmatic EVs. Briefly, 600 ml of plasma was treated with thrombin for 5 minutes at room temperature to remove clotting factors. The supernatant was mixed with 200 ml of precipitation buffer and incubated at 4\u00b0C for overnight and centrifuged (10,000 g for 30 min at room temperature). The pellet was vortexed for 5-15 minutes in 270 ml resuspension buffer until completely re-suspended. The EV miRNA was extracted using miRCURY RNA isolation kit-biofluids (Exiqon, Denmark) according to the manufacturer\u00b4s instruction. RNA spike-in template mixture (Exiqon, Denmark) was added as a quality control of the downstream PCR analysis.
